parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from etho; a race, i.e. A tribe; specially, a foreign one.
To mock, ridicule. From en and paizo; to jeer at, i.e. Deride.
To flog, scourge, the victim being strapped to a pole or frame; met: I chastise. From mastix; to flog.
From stauros; to impale on the cross; figuratively, to extinguish passion or selfishness.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Third. Ordinal from treis; third; neuter a third part, or a third time, thirdly.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
